item.title: AD ACL Access Control List (ACLs)
item.description:
• ACL is a general term used to describe a list of access control entries (ACEs) that define permissions for users or groups:
    • Can contain different types of access lists, like DACL and SACL.
    • ACL is a broad term encompassing both DACL and SACL.

Access Control List (ACLs):

  • Definition:

    • A list of permissions attached to an object, specifying who or what is allowed to access that object.

  • Use Case:

    • Granularity: ACLs are more granular, often attached to specific objects.

item.title: Windows Privileges
item.description:
Windows Privileges:

  • Definition

    • Special rights assigned to user accounts or groups.
    • Allow users to perform specific actions that affect the entire system or other users.

  • Examples

    • Change the system time
      • Allows user to modify the system clock.
    • Shut down the system
      • Grants the ability to power off or restart the computer.
    • Load and unload device drivers
      • Permits the installation and removal of system drivers.

  • Administration

    • Managed through Group Policy and user account settings.
    • Can be tailored for specific roles and responsibilities.

  • Security Implications
